medical_history.chief_complaint: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia due to 11-hydroxylase deficiency.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms involved ambiguous external genitalia and elevated hormone levels noted at birth. During follow-up visits, symptoms including accelerated bone age and elevated androgen levels were recorded, leading to further diagnostics.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The female patient A.T. showed ambiguous external genitalia and elevated 17-hydroxyprogesterone levels at birth. The male patient M.M. presented with genital and scrotal hyperplasia at age 2.5 years and had previous glucocorticoid treatment for adrenal issues. Patient Z.P. exhibited growth acceleration at age 4, with bone age acceleration noted.
medical_history.family_history: The patients in cases A.T., M.M., Z.P., and H.P. were born to healthy parents who are first-degree cousins, with no reported adrenal disorders in the family history.
medical_history.social_history: The family origins include Turkish for case A.T., Iraqi for case M.M., and Pakistani for cases Z.P. and H.P. There are no lifestyle factors, habits, or environmental exposures mentioned related to their current condition.
